meanings.definition: A person or thing that excites or stimulates.
meanings.sent1: The excitor, a lively puppy, always brings joy to the family.
meanings.sent2: The excitor at the party was the magician who amazed everyone with his tricks.
meanings.sent3: The excitor, a bouncy ball, bounced into the room and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter acted as an excitor, spreading happiness to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The excitor, a colorful painting, brightened up the dull room instantly.

meanings.definition: A device that generates electrical impulses to stimulate nerves or muscles.
meanings.sent1: The excitor, a small machine, helped the patient's muscles regain strength.
meanings.sent2: The excitor in the hospital room beeped rhythmically as it stimulated the nerves.
meanings.sent3: The excitor, a buzzing gadget, made funny noises while working on the muscles.
meanings.sent4: The excitor hummed softly, sending tiny shocks to wake up the dormant nerves.
meanings.sent5: The excitor, a helpful tool, brought movement back to the paralyzed limb.

meanings.definition: A substance that enhances the activity of a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The excitor, a special powder, boosted the catalyst's performance in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The excitor mixed seamlessly with the catalyst, improving its efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The excitor, a magical potion, made the catalyst work faster than ever before.
meanings.sent4: The excitor, a secret ingredient, unlocked the full potential of the catalyst.
meanings.sent5: The excitor, a powerful elixir, transformed the catalyst into a supercharged agent.
